abstract: ABC’s new police drama “The Unusuals” made a sluggish debut in the ratings on Wednesday, earning just 6.8 million viewers in its 10 p.m. time slot, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
snippet: ABC’s new police drama “The Unusuals” made a sluggish debut in the ratings on Wednesday, earning just 6.8 million viewers in its 10 p.m. time slot, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
lead_paragraph: ABC’s new police drama “The Unusuals” made a sluggish debut in the ratings on Wednesday, earning just 6.8 million viewers in its 10 p.m. time slot, according to Nielsen’s estimates. The new show, with Amber Tamblyn and Jeremy Renner, trailed behind CBS’s “CSI: NY” in its time period with half the audience (12.5 million), but it did outperform NBC’s 10 p.m. repeat of “Law & Order” (4.7 million).
